Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in its state protection analysis by focusing on applicants' interactions with police rather than assessing operational adequacy of Hungary's protection
Application_Facts: Roma family from Hungary claimed refugee status in Canada, citing persecution and lack of state protection
Decision_Outcome: The Board’s decision was unreasonable and must be set aside; claims remitted for redetermination
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Refugee Protection Division's decision
Court_Ruling: Application allowed; Board’s decision set aside; claims sent back to a different panel
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution, inadequate state protection in Hungary for Roma population
Legal_Standard: Section 96 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Assessment_Factor: Operational adequacy of Hungary's protection mechanisms
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review challenging Refugee Protection Division's decision
Evidence_Used: Documentary evidence showing inadequate protection efforts by Hungary towards Roma
Application_Basis: Inability or unwillingness to avail oneself of state protection due to fear of persecution
Evidence_Assessed: Applicants’ reporting (or lack thereof) to police, systemic persecution of Roma in Hungary
Governing_Rule: Under section 96 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, a claimant must be unable or unwilling to avail themselves of their country’s protection due to fear
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Board focused on applicants’ insufficient reporting to police, ignoring broader documentary evidence
Outcome: Application allowed; decision set aside; remitted for redetermination
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution faced by Roma in Hungary due to inadequate state protection
Cause_Description: Roma family from Hungary claimed refugee status in Canada, citing persecution and lack of state protection
Evidence_Handling: Board failed to properly consider documentary evidence on Hungary's operational inadequacy
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 96 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Issues: Overreliance on individual reporting behavior instead of systemic protection failures
Evidence_Assessment: Documentary evidence showed Hungary’s efforts were inadequate operationally
Decision_Rationale: Focus on individual interactions with police was misplaced; systemic failure to protect Roma required assessment of operational adequacy
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to assess operational adequacy despite available documentary evidence
Legal_Standard_Applied: Section 96 - inability to access state protection due to fear of persecution
